text:
when you have a filename which consists of multibyte 
characters, this is cut by mod_autoindex also after 20 bytes. 
That may result in invalid UTF-8 sequences. The cut should be 
made after 20 characters (might be multibyte ...)
creator: maccy2@yahoo.com

text:
As I understand it, mod_autoindex is unaware of the character encoding. There
should be an option that will make it aware of the charater encoding, and also
generate an appropriate Content-Type: text/html charset=... correctly.
Currently, there is no way to do an AddDefaultCharset only do the default
document of the directory. The only work-arround is to add a HEADER document
with a meta tag to specify the charset.
creator: rl@math.technion.ac.il
